"Explorer" widget
For some tasks when working with files, it is required to display not just a list of files, but also a certain logical structure of file ordering (like folders and classifications). In this case, one of the possible solutions will be to configure the "Explorer" widget.
Example of a configured widget:
The Explorer widget is made for solving the following tasks:
working with complementary files and documents (from different entities);
visualizing the logical structure (hierarchy and classification) of files;
attaching (uploading to the server) files and documents;
rearranging (moving) files in the structure;
the ability to sign files (if the
appropriate actions
are configured);
the ability to delete irrelevant files.
Widget components
The Explorer widget resembles the standard Windows explorer and consists of three complementary areas:
the top area (is analogous to the folder structure);
file display area (the main area of working with files);
versioning area (auxiliary information about the file).
When selecting a top (active check mark), a set of files is displayed for the active top, if a file is selected (active check mark), information about available versions can be shown for it.
If necessary, the analyst can change the proportions of the width of the areas or turn off the visibility of irrelevant areas. The proportions are adjusted using the
element.
Setting up the widget
Adding a widget to the object profile is done in the
visual of instance
configuration mode. When switching to the “Widgets” tab in the “Elements” panel, drag and drop the “Explorer” widget from the “Files” section to the workspace of the profile.
The widget’s functioning assumes:
setting up a hierarchical view;
writing algorithms for determining objects;
creating tops (and connecting algorithms).
Configuring the widget involves filling in the following parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Configuring the file hierarchy
Selecting hierarchy settings from the drop-down list. This hierarchy is set using the
"Configuring file hierarchical representation"
[FS_HIER] object type (more about
setting up a hierarchical display of files
).
Number of elements per page (directories)
Determining the number of elements (folders) displayed on the page in the top area (left area).
By default, the value of the parameter is “-1”, and all elements will be displayed on the same page.
Number of elements per page (files)
Determining the number of elements (files) displayed on the page in the file display area (center area).
By default, the value of the parameter is “-1”, and all elements will be displayed on the same page.
Control attributes
Determining the type attribute from the drop-down list. If the specified type attribute is changed, the System will automatically update the customized data representation. Otherwise, data is updated when objects are loaded/deleted.
Explorer display proportions
Defining proportions for displaying widget areas. When selecting the proportions, it is necessary to take into account that:
first value - top area (left box);
second value - file display area (center box);
third value - versioning area (right box).
By default, the parameter is set to “25 / 55 / 20%”.
Height (in px). Minimum value is 150
Force widget height setting, in px. The minimum value is 150 px.
By default, the parameter is set to "450".
Top area
Determining how to display the top area (left area). Possible values that will be used when opening the object profile:
revealed;
collapsed;
unavailable.
By default, the parameter is set to "Revealed".
Versioning area
Determining how to display the versioning area (right area). Learn more about
configuring versioning
. Possible values that will be used when opening the object profile:
revealed;
collapsed;
unavailable.
By default, the parameter is set to "Revealed".
Show bulk upload button
Defining the display of the
button for bulk document upload on the action bar. The system allows uploading several files at once. Without selecting this feature, the document can be added only after moving the cursor over a top (title in the left box).
Top names when bulk uploading files
Entering the
name
of the field to select the top to be used for all files in a bulk upload.
The parameter is used when the “Show bulk upload button” option is active.
Top switcher name when uploading files
Entering the
name
of the switch used in the bulk file upload modal window.
The parameter is used when the “Show bulk upload button” option is active.
Registry (Files)
The selection is made via a drop-down list of instances of the system type
“ Basic registry settings” [SYS_REGISTRY]
associated with the
“File” type [FS_FILE]
.
Automatically select the first item on the left
Determining the automatic selection – highlighting of the first top.
Show column "Employee who attached the file"
Determining the display of the
"Employee who attached the file" column
in the file display area.
Display signatures types
Determining the type of signature. It is used then downloading signature files to determine them.
The selection is made using a drop-down list of instances of the system type
“File Signature Type” [FS_FILE_SIGN_KIND]
.
Value algorithm "read-only"(return boolean)
Selecting an algorithm to display the read-only widget files. The value of the algorithm should return the boolean value (true or false).
Display custom filter
Determining the display of the custom filter string.
File info profile settings
Determining the displayed attributes of the “Document characteristics” profile located at the top of the widget’s versioning area.
Display the file signing button
Determining the display of a signing files button. If selected, the
button will be displayed in the widget’s action bar.
Signing actions
Define the actions available when clicking the
button on the widget’s action bar.
The parameter is available when the “Display file signing button” option is active.
Name for custom filter
Entering the
name
for the custom filter field.
Filter for custom filter
Determining a filter to generate a list of options for a custom filter.
The selection is made using a drop-down list of instances of
“Filter” [SYS_FILTER]
type .
The parameter is used when the “Display custom filter” option is active.
File filter for custom filter
Defining a filter to generate a list of files of objects selected in the custom filter.
Filter functioning involves setting a parameter with the identifier [FILE_EXPLORER_USER_FILTER] to which the codes of the selected objects will be sent.
The parameter is used when the “Display custom filter” option is active.
Display the navigation button
Determining the display of a button for moving a file from one top to another. The
button is displayed on the action bar.
Collapse folders on move by default
Determining collapsing all folders by default when moving files to make the hierarchy more compact.
The parameter is used when the “Display navigation button” option is active.
Advanced preview
Determining the possibility of an extended preview of the selected file.
Add files from System
Determining if files can be downloaded from the system.
When this option is active, adding files is possible both from disk and from the system:
Filter of files loaded from the system
Defining an algorithm for filtering files downloaded from the system.
The parameter is used when the “Add files from System” option is active.
Checking signatures by button
Determining the ability to verify signatures. If selected, the
button will be displayed in the widget’s header.
When this option is active, only manual signature verification is available, automatic signature verification will be disabled.
Display the signature of the buttons on the action bar
An attribute that determines the display of signatures for buttons on the widget’s action bar.
Display in snapshot mode
Allow displaying the status of a file on a specific date.
It is used, for example, to display files that are relevant at the time a business process task is completed.
The display of the "Add tags" and "Remove tags" buttons is adjusted using the settings of the
hierarchical file display
.
Working with the widget
Adding files
using the widget is possible from the file display area by clicking the
button or from the top area by clicking the
button. In the second case, the button is available after hovering the mouse cursor over the top.
The size of files uploaded to the System is limited. Find more details in the
article
.
Action bar
The display of buttons in the widget’s action bar depends on the selected element: the top or the file. The displayed (available) actions are applicable to the selected element.
Default actions available:
Button
Action
Download all files into one archive.
Download all files into one archive, taking into account the hierarchy.
Preview the selected file.
Delete the selected file.
Signatures of the selected file.
Export the hierarchy to Excel.
Copy the file link.
The display of other buttons is adjusted using the widget settings.
The buttons for working with the document are also displayed in the file field when you hover the cursor over it.
In case of signing a file, the user can view the signature information by clicking the
button from the action bar (the button will be displayed after selecting the signed file).
Versioning area
In the left area of the widget, after selecting a file, information about the classification of the file, its date of addition and a list of previous versions are displayed.
Previous versions are displayed when replacing a file using the corresponding button at the bottom of the area. The user can also download the file in the same way and select the current version from the list of previous versions of the file.
Display and search modes
Depending on the selected file display mode, the appearance of the file area will be different:
Tile
Table
If a search is required, use the corresponding interface element
.
Use example
Consider the example, where the analyst needs organize an interface for working with related documents (office format files, photocopies) for complementary object types using the "Explorer" widget.
Object model
For the technical services of the enterprise, it is necessary to organize the possibility of working with documents (and photocopies) for user types of objects (entities):
Elevator
[Elevator];
Inspection
[Inspection].
Due to object inheritance (from the "Object" parent type), the "ID" and "Name" attributes are initially present in entities along with their individual attributes.
Entities are related by the "Elevator" object attribute [ELEVATOR_ID] and contain file attributes:
Attached files
[SYS_FILE_ID] - equipment documents (technical certificate, etc.);
Attachment files
[ATT_FILE_ID] - inspection documents (inspection certificates, etc.).
It is required to configure the operation of the "Explorer" widget on the "Elevator" type profile according to the following scheme:
only the files of the selected elevator and its inspections are displayed;
in the hierarchy area, the elements (tops) "Elevator files" and "Files of completed inspections" are provided, in which all inspections of the current elevator are grouped;
when the hierarchy element is selected, the corresponding documents become available in the file display area;
the user can add new documents to the selected inspection;
the user-selected inspection has the ability to delete irrelevant files.
To solve this, previously connect (place) the "Explorer" widget on the "Elevator" profile type and start configuring the widget.
For the "Explorer" widget to function, the file hierarchy must be configured, which declares the rules for the operation of widget elements in the top area.
Configuring the file hierarchy
Within the framework of this example create (add) a hierarchy setting
HS_Elevator
(we use the HS_ prefix to avoid the appearance of objects of the same name in the System) by matching the setting to the
Elevator
object type.
Configuring tops of the hierarchy
The Explorer widget is based on working with the active (selected) tops. The tops (or nodes) of the hierarchy can receive files from various object types.
If necessary, tops can be nested and perceived by users as folders named of the file structure.
Each top must correspond to the object type and is associated with an algorithm (attribute "Algorithm for determining objects"), which returns a set of object instances to be displayed as a list of tops.
Although the System interface allows you to create algorithms during setup, it is recommended to prepare and debug the necessary algorithms in advance.
Configuring tops and algorithms
As part of the example, you will need to add two tops to the hierarchy setup:
1st top:
Elevator files
;
2nd top:
Files of completed inspections
.
Note that when you create each top, you must assign the original algorithm for determining objects, which prepares and forms a set (array) of objects to be shown when you activate a particular top.
In this case, you will only need to select existing algorithms:
Alg_set_current_object
(for the 1st top)
returns in object set format, a reference to the current object from the specified attribute of which files should be extracted;
Alg_inspections_set_for_equipment
(for the 2nd top)
returns a set of completed inspections for the current (active) elevator equipment. At the same time, an additional filter algorithm is required for the algorithm to function;
Alg_filter_inspections_equipment
(for the 2nd top)
receives the "Parameter_equipment" incoming parameter of the "Elevator" type and provides filtering of records corresponding to the equipment selected in the form.
Prepare the top algorithms in advance.
Top 1: Alg_set_current_object
Top 2: Alg_inspections_set_for_equipment and Alg_filter_inspections_equipment
To connect the algorithms, let’s switch to the adding tops to the hierarchy settings mode. When creating tops, set the corresponding properties (shown below).
Note that the
Elevator files
top will be related to the "Attached files" attribute of "Elevator" objects types , which will be returned by the appropriate algorithm. In this case, the three specified file classifications will be allowed to be displayed. The option to hide the header will allow you not to display the header of the nested structure when selecting a node (top).
For the
Files of completed inspections
top,there will be a relation with the "Attachment Files" attribute of the "Inspection" object types, which the algorithm will return. In this case, you will be allowed to work with files of two selected categories.
Setup result
After performing the specified configuration actions and saving the result, the "Explorer" widget containing two tops will be displayed on the "Elevator" type profile:
Elevator files;
Files of completed inspections (with a set of inspections).
Each top is characterized by a numeric file counter and the ability to view a nested list of files and documents.
Widget configuration functionally meets the requirements of the thematic task.
Conclusions
The Explorer widget allows you to combine complementary files and documents from different sources in one space. This allows the analyst to use the settings to solve non-standard tasks for organizing document flow at users' workplaces.
The complexity of configuring a widget is determined by its functionality and connectivity with other file management components. For simpler file processing tasks, simpler
widgets
and
visuals
may be sufficient.
